L2_gloss: The first letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.

Armenia (a country in Europe and Asia)
Арманистон яке аз кишварҳои Осиё ва Аврупо аст. ― Armaniston yake az kišvarhoyi Osiyo va Avrupo ast. ― (please add an English translation of this usage example)
The second letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
to forgive, to pardon, to absolve, to excuse, to give,
ignorant, uninformed, cautious, without giving notice,
Bratislava (the capital and largest city of Slovakia)

to be
Теҳрон пойтахт ва бузургтарин шаҳри Эрон аст.
Tehron poytaxt va buzurgtarin šahri Eron ast.
Tehran is the capital and largest city of Iran.
Bucharest (the capital and largest city of Romania)

Bukhara (a city in Uzbekistan)
1325-1390, Hafez, Diwan
Агар он Турки Шерозӣ бадаст орад дили моро  ба холи Ҳиндуяш бахшам Самарқанду Бухороро.
Agar on Turk-i Šerozī badast orad dil-i mo-ro  ba xol-i Hinduyaš baxšam Samarqand-u Buxoro-ro.
The third letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
duty, obligation, task (that which one is morally or
to exercise, to train, to cultivate
homeland, home country, motherland, fatherland, mother
domestic, national (internal to a specific country)
to edit (make changes to the text of a document)
the Vatican, Vatican City (a city-state in Southern Europe, an enclave within the city of Rome, Italy)
The fourth letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
to rot, decay, go bad, spoil
(vulgar) to fuck, to screw, to hump, Synonym: (vulgar)
mute, a person unable to speak
to say, to tell, to talk, to speak
The sixth letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.

enemy
Баъд аз 3 соли ҷанг бо душманони дохиливу хориҷӣ болшевикон тавонистанд ҳакимятро дар собиқ Империяи Русия ба даст оранд. ― Baʾd az 3 soli jang bo dušmanoni doxilivu xorijī bolševikon tavonistand hakimyatro dar sobiq Imperiyayi Rusiya ba dast orand. ― (please add an English translation of this usage example)

or
Имрӯз‍ ё фардо меравед? ― Imrüz‍ yo fardo meraved? ― Are you going today or tomorrow?
The seventh letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
The eighth letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
The seventh letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
The ninth letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
The tenth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ж (Ž) (Že) and is followed by the letter И (I) (I).
The eleventh letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter З (Z) (Ze) and is followed by the letter Ӣ (Ī) (Ī).
Isfahan (the capital city of Isfahan Province, Iran)
The thirteenth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ӣ (Ī) (Ī) and is followed by the letter К (K) (Ke).
book, Ин китобро хондам.In kitobro xondam.I read this
The sixteenth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Қ (Q) (Qe) and is followed by the letter М (M) (Me).
The seventeenth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Л (L) (Le) and is followed by the letter Н (N) (Ne).
square, plaza (of a town, etc.), field, plain
Moscow (a federal city, the capital of Russia)
to stay, to remain, to put
The eighteenth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter М (M) (Me) and is followed by the letter О (O) (O).
Nowruz, New Year in the Iranian/Zoroastrian calendar,
of good repute, 1210-1292, Saadi Shirazi, Ghazaliyyat,
The nineteenth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Н (N) (Ne) and is followed by the letter П (P) (Pe).
of or related to water, blue
custom, manner, mode, habit, rite, ritual, practice
plural of адаб (adab), greetings, salutation, etiquette,

institution, rite, ceremony, custom, ordinance, canon, usage, prescription
Synonyms: (rite, ceremony, custom) расм (rasm), (custom, usage) одат (odat)
sky, осмонӣ абри ― osmonī abri ― a cloudy sky., heaven,
The twentieth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter О (O) (O) and is followed by the letter Р (R) (Re).

urine, piss
Synonyms: бавл (bavl), идрор (idror), шоша (šoša)
cotton-bow, a stick formerly used by cotton carders for dressing cotton.
back (part of the body), rear, behind
The twenty-first letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter П (P) (Pe) and is followed by the letter С (S) (Se).

to dance
Synonym: рақс кардан (raqs kardan)

day
Се рӯз ки падарашон гум аст. ― Se rüz ki padarašon gum ast. ― Their father's been missing for three days. (literally, “Three days that their father is missing.”)
Syr Darya, a major river in Central Asia
sum, Kyrgyz and Uzbek national unit of currency., ruble
The twenty-third letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter С (S) (Se) and is followed by the letter У (U) (U).

to be able to
Наметавонад. ― Nametavonad. ― He can't.
shortcoming, fault, guilt, mistake, blame, defect,
The twenty-sixth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ӯ (Ü) (Ü) and is followed by the letter Х (X) (Xe).

to understand
Ман намефаҳмам. ― Man namefahmam. ― I don't understand.
The twenty-seventh letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ф (F) (Fe) and is followed by the letter Ҳ (H) (He).
to want, (auxiliary) Used in subjunctive tense in conjunction
The twenty-ninth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ҳ (H) (He) and is followed by the letter Ҷ (J) (Je).
chinar, oriental plane, Platanus orientalis, Platanus
The thirty-first letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ҷ (J) (Je) and is followed by the letter Ъ (ʾ) (ʾ).
wine, juice (of grapes), juice (of other fruits)
dark blue mixed with red[1], 1977,  Аминҷон Шукӯҳӣ,
to know, be acquainted with, to acknowledge, to discern,

to wash
Ӯ дасташро мешӯяд.Ü dastašro mešüyad.He/She is washing his/her hand.

The thirty-second letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ш (Š) (Še) and is followed by the letter Э (E) (E). Often transcribed as " ' " or " " ", named Твёрди з́нак or Tvordi znak, it indicates a hard stop, or [ʔ] in IPA form.
The thirty-third letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ъ (ʾ) and is followed by the letter Ю (Yu).
The thirty-fourth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Э (E) (E) and is followed by the letter Я (Ya) (Ya).
The thirty-fifth and final letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ю (Yu) (Yu).
The fifth letter of the Tajik alphabet
The fifth letter of the Tajik alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.
noise, clamor, clamour, quarrel, uproar, disturbance,
The fifteenth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter К (K) (Ke) and is followed by the letter Л (L) (Le).
Kha with descender, a letter in the Tajik alphabet.
The twenty-eighth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Х (X) (Xe) and is followed by the letter Ч (Č) (Če).
Creates plural form for regular nouns, Synonym: -он
The thirtieth letter of the Tajik alphabet
The thirtieth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter Ч (Č) (Če) and is followed by the letter Ш (Š) (Še).
answer, reply, вай ҷавоби хубе надод ― vay javobi xube
binding (of a book), volume (of a book), skin, hide,
The twelfth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter И (I) (I) and is followed by the letter Й (Y) (Yi).
The twelfth letter of the Tajik alphabet
The twenty-fifth letter of the Tajik Cyrillic alphabet. It is preceded by the letter У (U) (U) and is followed by the letter Ф (F) (Fe).
